headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: Just one thing on that confidence. You said publicly in the past that retrans and reverse comp will be at least $250 million. And given that you signed more deals, can you give us any kind of update on expectations for that line?
componenttext: Just one thing on that confidence. You said publicly in the past that retrans and reverse comp will be at least $250 million. And given that you signed more deals, can you give us any kind of update on expectations for that line?

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: You know what, we're not going to go much beyond that. We are confident we're going to hit the $250 million, and it will probably be more than that.
componenttext: You know what, we're not going to go much beyond that. We are confident we're going to hit the $250 million, and it will probably be more than that.

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: We'll go next to Michael Nathanson with Nomura.
componenttext: We'll go next to Michael Nathanson with Nomura.

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: I have just 3 quick housekeeping ones. In the first paragraph, you talked about the challenging of -- challenge by the timing of syndication sales. Are you referring to timing of last year's syndication or do you have more syndication to come in the fourt
componenttext: I have just 3 quick housekeeping ones. In the first paragraph, you talked about the challenging of -- challenge by the timing of syndication sales. Are you referring to timing of last year's syndication or do you have more syndication to come in the fourth quarter -- pushing into the fourth quarter?

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: Yes, it's when we make the shows available. So as the next season, Michael, airs, so there's more to come later. So we made more episodes available in Q3 of 2010 than Q3 of 2011.
componenttext: Yes, it's when we make the shows available. So as the next season, Michael, airs, so there's more to come later. So we made more episodes available in Q3 of 2010 than Q3 of 2011.

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: Okay. There wasn't anything about a sale push into the fourth quarter that's going to come of...
componenttext: Okay. There wasn't anything about a sale push into the fourth quarter that's going to come of...

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: No.
componenttext: No.

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then, the comment about the programming mix driving savings, can you give us a sense taking out the timing benefits? In this quarter, what do you think your programming savings were like-for-like in Q3?
componenttext: Okay. And then, the comment about the programming mix driving savings, can you give us a sense taking out the timing benefits? In this quarter, what do you think your programming savings were like-for-like in Q3?

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: Well, let me answer -- it's Joe, Michael. Let me answer the question this way. I think you look at the Entertainment segment margin on a year-to-date basis, you see it's 20%, which is an 800 basis point improvement year-over-year. We clearly think that's
componenttext: Well, let me answer -- it's Joe, Michael. Let me answer the question this way. I think you look at the Entertainment segment margin on a year-to-date basis, you see it's 20%, which is an 800 basis point improvement year-over-year. We clearly think that's sustainable.

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: Okay, okay. And third would be, you mentioned that primetime was up 4% in the third quarter. I wonder if you think do you sequentially improve with the new upfront base in Q4 from the 4% level in third quarter?
componenttext: Okay, okay. And third would be, you mentioned that primetime was up 4% in the third quarter. I wonder if you think do you sequentially improve with the new upfront base in Q4 from the 4% level in third quarter?

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: Yes, judging from the fact, obviously, we all know how strong the upfront was. And frankly, the scatter is above that. So we anticipate that it will grow significantly from there.
componenttext: Yes, judging from the fact, obviously, we all know how strong the upfront was. And frankly, the scatter is above that. So we anticipate that it will grow significantly from there.

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: We'll go next to Michael Morris with Davenport.
componenttext: We'll go next to Michael Morris with Davenport.

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: Two questions. First, on Showtime, the growth there continues to be very strong and ahead of HBO, which I would consider your closest peer. You seem to still be growing your subscriber base. I'm just trying to think of when you look at a competitor like H
componenttext: Two questions. First, on Showtime, the growth there continues to be very strong and ahead of HBO, which I would consider your closest peer. You seem to still be growing your subscriber base. I'm just trying to think of when you look at a competitor like HBO, did they sort of represent what you see as the cap in the traditional model for that type of network? Or do you think that there's demand or you could have a structure that would allow you to grow beyond that? And then I have a follow-up.

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: You know what, that's a very good question. We're currently over 21 million subs, and they're over 28. We are Avis, but I think, clearly, we are growing. Our programming mix, we think our original programming is stronger than it was even a couple of years
componenttext: You know what, that's a very good question. We're currently over 21 million subs, and they're over 28. We are Avis, but I think, clearly, we are growing. Our programming mix, we think our original programming is stronger than it was even a couple of years ago. And there's a reason for that growth. I think subscribers want Showtime. More people want Showtime. Most households that have Showtime also have HBO. So the fact that we're growing, can we go beyond 28 million? One day, I hope so.

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: Great. Appreciate it. And one other thing, Les. You mentioned that I thought was interesting, your incremental was that when you -- the new reverse compensation deal that you struck not only will start to provide revenue starting in mid-2012, but also tak
componenttext: Great. Appreciate it. And one other thing, Les. You mentioned that I thought was interesting, your incremental was that when you -- the new reverse compensation deal that you struck not only will start to provide revenue starting in mid-2012, but also take some costs out. I assume take costs out of the Entertainment segment. I'm trying to gauge how big that is. Does that extend to your other affiliated stations that you may also have...

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: You know, Michael, there were only a few station groups left that we will pay in compensation to. These last couple of deals will wipe that out entirely. By the middle of '12, we will not be paying out anybody and it all comes in. So this will be a cost s
componenttext: You know, Michael, there were only a few station groups left that we will pay in compensation to. These last couple of deals will wipe that out entirely. By the middle of '12, we will not be paying out anybody and it all comes in. So this will be a cost savings, as well as a total reversal. As we said, instead of paying, we're getting paid. So that's a good way to be.

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: We'll go next to Laura Martin with Needham & Company.
componenttext: We'll go next to Laura Martin with Needham & Company.

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: Let's talk about Hulu. So Les, you guys just signed a really wide-ranging deal for The CW. Could you talk about the similarities and differences as you think about the CBS Network and CW and specifically on Hulu Prime? Should we expect the deal announced
componenttext: Let's talk about Hulu. So Les, you guys just signed a really wide-ranging deal for The CW. Could you talk about the similarities and differences as you think about the CBS Network and CW and specifically on Hulu Prime? Should we expect the deal announced near term on Hulu Prime and CBS? And then, boy, margins, wow, Joe, cost control hitting record margins. You told us a year ago you're going to do this and I think you delivered it faster. Can you tell us about margins next year? Because a lot of what you just went over looks like it's got 70% or 80% margin. So as a company, where do you think margins can go in 2012 and 2013?

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: Thanks, Laura. I'll do the Hulu question, and then Joe can talk about margins. Yes, obviously, CBS has been the lone holdout with Hulu and Hulu Plus. The CW is a different animal. It appeals to a much younger demographic. In addition, frankly, a lot more
componenttext: Thanks, Laura. I'll do the Hulu question, and then Joe can talk about margins. Yes, obviously, CBS has been the lone holdout with Hulu and Hulu Plus. The CW is a different animal. It appeals to a much younger demographic. In addition, frankly, a lot more of the viewers of CW are watching online. So the majority of this deal deals with a -- it will go on Hulu Plus at first. And then 8 days later, it will go on Hulu. The significance of this deal is that we did get paid a chunk of money. There is no advertising split on this, which is something that we absolutely refuse to do. Were we considerably more liberal with making a deal with Hulu for CW? Absolutely. But as I said before, The CW went from being a money loser for CBS to a profitable venture for us overall. So these 2 deals made a lot of sense for us.

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: And Laura, on the margin, I think -- again, I think you're right. I mean, we said this was coming. It's clear why it's coming. Retrans, reverse compensation, these streaming deals, these are very high-margin deals. So I think, again, as we  continue, we h
componenttext: And Laura, on the margin, I think -- again, I think you're right. I mean, we said this was coming. It's clear why it's coming. Retrans, reverse compensation, these streaming deals, these are very high-margin deals. So I think, again, as we  continue, we have a way to go on them. Advertising, also very high margins. So I think the combination of managing your costs and having these incremental revenue streams, we're not just saying the words, you're seeing the results in our numbers.

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: We'll go next to Doug Mitchelson with Deutsche Bank.
componenttext: We'll go next to Doug Mitchelson with Deutsche Bank.

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: Just a few quick questions, a couple for Joe. Have you shifted amortization accounting for production of new TV shows now that the online window has been firmly established for you so you expense less upfront as you allocate costs against that online wind
componenttext: Just a few quick questions, a couple for Joe. Have you shifted amortization accounting for production of new TV shows now that the online window has been firmly established for you so you expense less upfront as you allocate costs against that online window?

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: No -- let's talk about The CW deal that we just announced. For the CBS studio shows, we've not adjusted the amortization for that. We -- obviously, we will look at the ultimate accounting in the fourth quarter for that. Obviously, the bigger benefit, Doug
componenttext: No -- let's talk about The CW deal that we just announced. For the CBS studio shows, we've not adjusted the amortization for that. We -- obviously, we will look at the ultimate accounting in the fourth quarter for that. Obviously, the bigger benefit, Doug, is when you make those shows available to the syndicator is when you recognize the revenue. But clearly, as we get more and more data points and as the value of these properties increase, that will get reflected in our amortization.

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: So that onetime reset is probably more of a 2012 event than a 2011 event, right?
componenttext: So that onetime reset is probably more of a 2012 event than a 2011 event, right?

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: I think that's fair.
componenttext: I think that's fair.

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: And then, can you give us any sense of how Oprah might have influenced revenue and margin comparisons in Entertainment year-over-year?
componenttext: And then, can you give us any sense of how Oprah might have influenced revenue and margin comparisons in Entertainment year-over-year?

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: Yes, look, we distributed Oprah, as you know. And during the last years, the amount of our distribution fee went down significantly, so I won't say it's terrific to lose Oprah. But a couple of positive things happened for the CBS Corporation. Number one,
componenttext: Yes, look, we distributed Oprah, as you know. And during the last years, the amount of our distribution fee went down significantly, so I won't say it's terrific to lose Oprah. But a couple of positive things happened for the CBS Corporation. Number one, Judge Judy became the #1 show in syndication. Dr. Phil became the #1 talk show in syndication, 2 shows that we own. Number three, obviously, Oprah had been on the ABC television stations by and large. So as a result, that time period where we became much stronger helped our station group a great deal. So as I said, no knock on Oprah. Oprah was an institution, and we were very happy to distribute her. But because of these factors, I think we are going to be in very good shape as a result.

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: We'll go next to John Janedis with UBS.
componenttext: We'll go next to John Janedis with UBS.

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: Guys, just going back to streaming. I think for the most part, the deals you've written have been guaranteed or upfront payment. So I'm wondering, looking ahead, I think the newer players that are going to be out there are going to have a harder time aggr
componenttext: Guys, just going back to streaming. I think for the most part, the deals you've written have been guaranteed or upfront payment. So I'm wondering, looking ahead, I think the newer players that are going to be out there are going to have a harder time aggregating to subscribers. So can you talk about your appetite for deals that are success-based or non-guaranteed?

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: We -- frankly, we don't believe in them. We're not going to go out and we've sort of -- we've even been against joining Apple TV, which was an advertiser split. And these deals are significant in that we are getting guaranteed cash payment. We like operat
componenttext: We -- frankly, we don't believe in them. We're not going to go out and we've sort of -- we've even been against joining Apple TV, which was an advertiser split. And these deals are significant in that we are getting guaranteed cash payment. We like operating on that basis. And as you said, we've been able to do deals worth hundreds and hundreds of millions of dollars on that basis. That is our position right now. Will we ever make a statement that that never could happen? I wouldn't right now because we don't know how the world evolves, but I like the way we played our hand and getting this guaranteed revenue stream is a good way to go.

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: We'll go next to David Miller with Caris & Company.
componenttext: We'll go next to David Miller with Caris & Company.

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: Les, correct me if I'm wrong, you guys actually have 4 separate television libraries in a sense, correct? You've got CBS, Paramount, King World and Aaron Spelling. How penetrated would you say you are within each of those 4 libraries with regard to over t
componenttext: Les, correct me if I'm wrong, you guys actually have 4 separate television libraries in a sense, correct? You've got CBS, Paramount, King World and Aaron Spelling. How penetrated would you say you are within each of those 4 libraries with regard to over the top deals? What inning are we in right now with regard to further exploitation of that content?

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: Yes, we do have those 4 libraries. We actually have a couple of others. We have Rysher is in there as well and a couple of other smaller independent companies that go way back. Desilu, we have all theirs going considerably back. I would venture to say, in
componenttext: Yes, we do have those 4 libraries. We actually have a couple of others. We have Rysher is in there as well and a couple of other smaller independent companies that go way back. Desilu, we have all theirs going considerably back. I would venture to say, in terms of library -- and right now, the good news is we don't distinguish. I couldn't tell you, frankly, what was a Paramount show or a CBS show. We're probably in the third inning. If that -- well, between the second and third inning, and we got Albert Pujols coming to bat. So we're feeling very good about what the future is, and there's a lot more room to grow. Obviously, these initial deals did include a lot of the primo titles. But there's still plenty more, and these deals are short term. And there are other people going into the marketplace, that's why this content is forever.

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: We'll go next to David Bank with RBC Capital Markets.
componenttext: We'll go next to David Bank with RBC Capital Markets.

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: Almost as a follow-up to that question, Les, you pointed you have 20 of the top 30 shows right now. And one of the things you've taught us really well is the value of these shows is far greater often than in the ancillary kind of secondary markets. And so
componenttext: Almost as a follow-up to that question, Les, you pointed you have 20 of the top 30 shows right now. And one of the things you've taught us really well is the value of these shows is far greater often than in the ancillary kind of secondary markets. And so the question is, if you look at that mix of shows today that you're having such success with, the only pipeline for syndication that's announced, Rules of Engagement, NCIS: L.A., Hawaii Five-0. What are the next big shows to kind of come out into syndication given the success you've had so far? And how -- can you talk about order of magnitude of contribution over the next couple of years?

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: Yes. I mean, obviously, Hawaii Five-0 and NCIS: L.A. were the last 2 big deals that we announced for domestic syndication. We still have Blue Bloods. We still have The Good Wife. This year, we have a new show called Unforgettable, which is substantial. An
componenttext: Yes. I mean, obviously, Hawaii Five-0 and NCIS: L.A. were the last 2 big deals that we announced for domestic syndication. We still have Blue Bloods. We still have The Good Wife. This year, we have a new show called Unforgettable, which is substantial. And we have a couple of mid-season shows that are coming on, one starring Rob Schneider and another drama from the De Niro company that is coming on mid-season that we own. So the pipeline will continue. Our only problem looking down the road is our schedule is so strong, I got to find places to find new shows that we own, but we will find them. In addition, there will be Showtime programming. That's produced internally by Showtime and by CBS. So we have a lot of different avenues to produce these new programs, and we even have a couple of shows on other cable networks. So the pipeline will continue.

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: We'll go next to Michael Meltz with JPMorgan.
componenttext: We'll go next to Michael Meltz with JPMorgan.

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: Can you just clarify and perhaps quantify, where is scatter actually pacing for Q4, please, at the network?
componenttext: Can you just clarify and perhaps quantify, where is scatter actually pacing for Q4, please, at the network?

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: It's mid-teens right now.
componenttext: It's mid-teens right now.

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: Our last question comes from Marci Ryvicker with Wells Fargo.
componenttext: Our last question comes from Marci Ryvicker with Wells Fargo.

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: I have just a couple. Joe, you said local was up 2% x political. So focusing on TV, does this number include retrans or is it a core advertising number?
componenttext: I have just a couple. Joe, you said local was up 2% x political. So focusing on TV, does this number include retrans or is it a core advertising number?

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: It actually doesn't swing the percentage, Marci. Either way, it's up the same, 2%, with or without retrans.
componenttext: It actually doesn't swing the percentage, Marci. Either way, it's up the same, 2%, with or without retrans.

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then, in Outdoor, can you just...
componenttext: Okay. And then, in Outdoor, can you just...

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: Marci, I want to point out that the way we record our retrans, it's split. Other TV stations record 100% of it. As you know, we record 50% in the Entertainment segment and 50% in Local Broadcasting.
componenttext: Marci, I want to point out that the way we record our retrans, it's split. Other TV stations record 100% of it. As you know, we record 50% in the Entertainment segment and 50% in Local Broadcasting.

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: Right. Okay. And then, in Outdoor, what was the foreign exchange impact in the third quarter?
componenttext: Right. Okay. And then, in Outdoor, what was the foreign exchange impact in the third quarter?

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: Almost 3 points.
componenttext: Almost 3 points.

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then my last one, there's been a lot of M&A in the broadcast base. So any thoughts about revisiting a sale of Radio assets or even at some point, TV assets?
componenttext: Okay. And then my last one, there's been a lot of M&A in the broadcast base. So any thoughts about revisiting a sale of Radio assets or even at some point, TV assets?

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: Highly doubtful, highly doubtful. We like the way they're performing. And if somebody came along and made us a phenomenal offer for some radio stations, we would always look at it. But we're pretty pleased with what we have right now.
componenttext: Highly doubtful, highly doubtful. We like the way they're performing. And if somebody came along and made us a phenomenal offer for some radio stations, we would always look at it. But we're pretty pleased with what we have right now.

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: Great. Thanks, Marci, and thanks, everyone, for joining us this afternoon. Have a great evening.
componenttext: Great. Thanks, Marci, and thanks, everyone, for joining us this afternoon. Have a great evening.

headline: CBS Corporation, Q3 2011 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2011
componenttextpreview: That does conclude today's conference. We thank you for your participation.
componenttext: That does conclude today's conference. We thank you for your participation.
